Subject: Stocks rise; Treasuries steady
First Comment: U.S. stocks edged higher in choppy trading on Friday as market participants weighed Thursday’s inflation report and looked toward next week's Federal Reserve policy decision. The Dow added 13 points, paring its weekly decline to 0.8%. The S&P 500 rose 0.2% to a fresh record level, ending the week slightly higher (+0.4%). The Nasdaq Composite advanced 0.4%, capping its fourth consecutive weekly gain (+1.9%), its longest such stretch since the start of this year.
Second Comment: Treasuries weakened modestly, with the yield on the 10-year note up one basis point to 1.45%, rising for the first time in four days. Still, the benchmark rate hovered near its lowest level since early March, posting its biggest weekly drop in a year (-11 basis points). On the data front, a preliminary gauge from the University of Michigan showed consumer sentiment improving more than expected in June. The release also revealed an unexpected decline in consumers’ inflationary expectations over the next 12 months. In commodities, WTI crude added 0.7% to $70.79/barrel. COMEX gold slipped 0.9% to $1,876.40/ounce as the U.S. dollar rebounded 0.5%.
Third Comment: Eight of 11 S&P 500 sectors closed in positive territory, with Financials and Tech among the standouts. Health Care lagged despite outperforming on a weekly basis. Vertex Pharmaceuticals fell 11% after halting the development of its experimental therapy intended to treat a rare genetic disease. In earnings, Dave & Buster's lost 2.7% despite posting a surprise profit tally, while Chewy declined 5.8% as a warning about supply chain issues and labor shortages overshadowed otherwise upbeat quarterly figures.

Subject: Stocks waver midday, head for mixed week
First Comment: U.S. stocks are fluctuating near midsession Friday as market participants continue to assess yesterday's inflation report and look toward next week's Federal Reserve policy decision. The Dow is off 54 points, reversing an earlier advance and on track to finish 1% lower for the week. The S&P 500 is trading just below the flat line after notching a new closing record level on Thursday. The Nasdaq Composite is adding 0.1%, set to cap its fourth consecutive weekly advance.
Second Comment: Treasuries are modestly weakening, with the yield on the 10-year note adding two basis points to 1.46%, rising for the first time in four days. Still, the benchmark rate is near the lowest level since early March, having fallen 10 basis points from a week ago. On the data front today, a gauge of consumer sentiment from the University of Michigan improved to a better-than-expected 86.4 in early June from May’s 82.9 reading. In commodities, WTI crude is adding 0.7% to $70.75/barrel. COMEX gold is falling 1% to $1875.50/ounce as the U.S. dollar rises 0.6%.
Third Comment: In corporate news, Vertex Pharmaceuticals is falling 10% after halting the development of its experimental therapy intended to treat a rare genetic disease. In earnings, Dave & Buster's is off 1% despite posting a surprise profit tally, while Chewy is slipping 5.5% as a warning about supply chain issues and labor shortages overshadows upbeat quarterly figures. Breadth is positive on issues by 3:2 on the NYSE and 5:4 on the Nasdaq. Composite NYSE volume is 1.6 billion shares.

Subject: Stocks rise in early trading Friday
First Comment: U.S. stocks are higher in early trading Friday as market participants continue to digest yesterday's key inflation report and look toward next week's Federal Reserve policy decision. The Dow is up 43 points, while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite are adding 0.1% and 0.2%, respectively. For the week, the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite are each set to rise, with the latter poised for its fourth consecutive weekly advance. The Dow has lagged on a weekly basis, on track to finish 0.7% lower.
Second Comment: The early gains follow an upbeat session on Thursday despite the CPI report surprising to the upside. The S&P 500 closed at a fresh record high for the first time since May 7, while the Dow added 19 points. The Nasdaq Composite rallied 0.8%. On the data front today, a preliminary update from the University of Michigan showed consumer sentiment improving in June. Treasuries are modestly weakening, with the yield on the benchmark 10-year note adding one basis point to 1.45%, rising for the first time in four days but still near the lowest level since early March.
Third Comment: In corporate news, Vertex Pharmaceuticals is falling 9.8% after halting the development of its experimental therapy intended to treat a rare genetic disease. In earnings, Dave & Buster's is up 6.2% following a surprise profit tally, while Chewy is off 2.5% despite providing upbeat quarterly figures, with a warning about supply chain issues and labor shortages weighing on shares. Breadth is positive on issues by roughly 2:1 on both the NYSE and Nasdaq.
